Title.evidence: This multicentre randomized trial for surgical skin antisepsis

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicentre randomized trial for surgical skin antisepsis

Participants.evidence: clean-contaminated gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary-pancreatic surgeries in five hospitals

Objective.evidence: The aim of this study was to evaluate the efficacy of aqueous olanexidine compared with chlorhexidine-alcohol

Number_Randomised.evidence: 700 patients from five institutions underwent randomization

Number_Analysed.evidence: 347 received olanexidine and 345 received chlorhexidine-alcohol in the full analysis set

Result_Outcome.evidence: 30-day SSI rate was 12.4% (43 of 347) in the olanexidine group and 13.6% (47 of 345) in the chlorhexidine-alcohol group (adjusted risk ratio (aRR) 0.911 (95% c.i. 0.625 to 1.327); P = 0.626)

Harms.evidence: Overall adverse effects were seen in two patients (0.58%) in the olanexidine group and in three patients (0.87%) in the chlorhexidine-alcohol group

Trial_Registration.evidence: Registration number: UMIN 000049712 (University Hospital Medical Information Network Clinical Trials Registry)
